Filters.filterDesc: A class in programming languages serves as a blueprint or template for creating objects, which are instances of that class.
A function in programming is a self-contained block of code that performs a specific task.
A variable in programming is a named storage location used to hold data that can change during the execution of a program.
A conditional in programming is a statement that allows the execution of certain code blocks based on specific conditions.

Playgrounds.playgroundDesc: A Class is a fundamental concept in object-oriented programming (OOP). It serves as a blueprint or template for creating objects. A class encapsulates data for the object (attributes or properties) and functions (methods) that operate on the data.
A function is a self-contained block of code that performs a specific task.
A variable is a named storage location used to hold data that can change during the execution of a program.
